title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A room of state in King Lear's palace, Britain
scene_summary: King Lear, intending to divide his kingdom, asks his daughters—Goneril, Regan, and Cordelia—to profess their love. Goneril and Regan flatter him, gaining portions, but Cordelia's honest restraint angers Lear, who disinherits her. Kent defends Cordelia and is banished. France marries Cordelia without a dowry, and Lear assigns his power to Goneril and Regan's husbands, Albany and Cornwall, setting up the tragedy of misjudgment.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A room in Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Edmund, Gloucester's illegitimate son, plots to supplant his brother, Edgar, by forging a letter suggesting Edgar plans to kill Gloucester. Gloucester, deceived, condemns Edgar. Edmund warns Edgar to flee, feigning loyalty, establishing his Machiavellian scheming and the parallel family conflict.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A room in Albany's palace, Britain
scene_summary: Goneril, irritated by Lear's rowdy knights, instructs her steward, Oswald, to treat them coldly, aiming to provoke Lear and reduce his influence. She plans to write to Regan, aligning their resistance, showing her ingratitude and ambition.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A hall in Albany's palace, Britain
scene_summary: Kent, disguised, pledges loyalty to Lear, who accepts him. Lear's Fool mocks his folly in dividing the kingdom. Goneril confronts Lear over his knights' behavior, demanding he reduce their number. Enraged, Lear curses her and departs for Regan's, realizing his error, while Goneril sends Oswald to warn Regan, escalating the family rift.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A courtyard before Albany's palace, Britain
scene_summary: Lear, preparing to leave for Regan's, sends Kent with letters to announce his arrival. The Fool warns Lear of further betrayal, and Lear, troubled, prays not to go mad, reflecting his growing awareness of his daughters' disloyalty and his precarious mental state.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A courtyard in Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Edmund tricks Edgar into fleeing, staging a fight to convince Gloucester of Edgar's treachery. Gloucester vows to capture Edgar, rewarding Edmund. Regan and Cornwall arrive, aligning with Edmund against Lear, strengthening the conspiracy and isolating Lear further.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: Before Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Kent, delivering Lear's letters, insults Oswald, Goneril's steward, and is put in the stocks by Cornwall and Regan. Kent reads a letter from Cordelia, hinting at her return. Gloucester protests the harsh treatment, but Regan dismisses him, showing her cruelty and Lear's diminishing authority.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A heath, Britain
scene_summary: Edgar, hiding, resolves to disguise himself as Poor Tom, a mad beggar, to escape capture. His soliloquy reflects on his fall from grace, paralleling Lear's descent and introducing the theme of survival through disguise.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: Before Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Lear arrives, finding Kent stocked, and is outraged. Regan and Cornwall refuse to see him, citing fatigue. When they appear, Regan sides with Goneril, demanding Lear dismiss all his knights. Lear, betrayed, rages and leaves for the heath as a storm brews, cursing his daughters, marking his descent into madness.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A heath, Britain
scene_summary: A Gentleman tells Kent of Lear's solitary raving in the storm. Kent reveals Cordelia's plan to aid Lear, backed by France. He urges the Gentleman to inform Cordelia, setting up her intervention as the storm symbolizes Lear's turmoil.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: Another part of the heath, Britain
scene_summary: Lear, with the Fool, defies the storm, railing against nature and his daughters' betrayal. Kent finds them, urging shelter. The Fool's riddles underscore Lear's folly, and Lear's speeches reveal his growing madness and insight into injustice, deepening the tragedy.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A room in Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Gloucester confides in Edmund about a plot to aid Lear, unaware Edmund plans to betray him to Cornwall. Edmund schemes to seize Gloucester's lands, aligning with Regan and Goneril, advancing his treachery and Gloucester's peril.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A hovel on the heath, Britain
scene_summary: Lear, Kent, and the Fool find shelter in a hovel, where Edgar, as Poor Tom, feigns madness. Lear, empathizing, questions human suffering, nearing insanity. Gloucester arrives, offering refuge, but Lear insists on “trying” Poor Tom, reflecting his obsession with justice amidst chaos.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A room in Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Edmund betrays Gloucester to Cornwall, showing the letter about aiding Lear. Cornwall names Edmund Earl of Gloucester, vowing to punish his father, solidifying Edmund's rise and Gloucester's impending doom.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A farmhouse near Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Gloucester hides Lear, Kent, the Fool, and Edgar in a farmhouse. Lear, mad, stages a mock trial of Goneril and Regan, with Edgar and the Fool as judges. Gloucester warns of a plot against Lear, urging Kent to flee to Dover. Edgar pities Lear, as the scene blends madness, pathos, and the looming threat.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A room in Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Cornwall and Regan interrogate Gloucester, accusing him of treason. They tie him up, and Cornwall blinds him, gouging out his eyes. A servant, outraged, wounds Cornwall but is killed. Gloucester, realizing Edmund's betrayal, is cast out, and Cornwall, injured, plans further action, marking a peak of brutality.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A heath, Britain
scene_summary: Edgar, as Poor Tom, encounters the blinded Gloucester, led by an Old Man. Gloucester, despairing, asks to be led to Dover's cliffs to die. Edgar agrees, hiding his identity, guiding his father, blending filial pity with the play's themes of suffering and redemption.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: Before Albany's palace, Britain
scene_summary: Goneril learns Albany disapproves of her cruelty to Lear. A messenger reports Cornwall's death and Gloucester's blinding, alarming Goneril. She fears Regan's rivalry for Edmund, sending Oswald with letters, while Albany vows to avenge Gloucester, signaling his moral shift.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: The French camp near Dover, Britain
scene_summary: Kent, in the French camp, learns Cordelia is moved by Lear's suffering. She prepares to rescue him, supported by France's forces. Kent notes Lear's shame prevents reunion, setting up Cordelia's redemptive role amidst the war.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A tent in the French camp near Dover, Britain
scene_summary: Cordelia sends soldiers to find Lear, described as mad and wandering. A Doctor reports Lear's need for rest, and Cordelia prays for his recovery. Alarms signal British forces, led by Regan and Edmund, preparing for battle, escalating the conflict.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A room in Gloucester's castle, Britain
scene_summary: Regan interrogates Oswald about Goneril's letters to Edmund, suspecting a romantic rival. She orders him to kill Gloucester and secure the letters, revealing her jealousy and ruthless ambition as the sisters' alliance frays.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: Fields near Dover, Britain
scene_summary: Edgar, leading Gloucester, pretends they're at Dover's cliffs. Gloucester attempts suicide but falls safely, believing he's survived. Lear, mad, encounters them, railing against injustice. Cordelia's men find Lear, but he flees. Edgar learns of the impending battle, guiding Gloucester to safety, blending pathos and hope.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A tent in the French camp near Dover, Britain
scene_summary: Cordelia reunites with the restored Lear, who awakens, repentant, and recognizes her. They reconcile, and Cordelia prepares to face the British army, despite the odds. Kent and the Doctor observe, hopeful, marking a moment of redemption before the tragic climax.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: The British camp near Dover, Britain
scene_summary: Regan and Edmund plan to defeat Cordelia's forces, but Regan fears Goneril's designs on Edmund. Edgar, disguised, delivers Goneril's letter to Albany, exposing her plot with Edmund. Albany vows justice, while Edmund schemes to kill Cordelia and Lear if victorious, setting up the battle and moral reckoning.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: A field between the camps near Dover, Britain
scene_summary: The French army, led by Cordelia and Lear, is defeated. Edgar urges Gloucester to flee as British forces advance. The brief scene marks the tragic turning point, with Lear and Cordelia captured.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
location: The British camp near Dover, Britain
scene_summary: Edmund imprisons Lear and Cordelia, ordering their deaths. Albany arrests Edmund and Goneril for treason, prompted by Edgar's evidence. Edgar duels Edmund, mortally wounding him, and reveals his identity. Goneril poisons Regan and suicides. Edmund, repentant, tries to save Cordelia, but she's hanged. Lear dies of grief, carrying her body. Albany cedes power to Kent and Edgar, who mourn, ending with despair and tentative renewal.
